Clause.Text: that year, if the boiler’s or heater’s NOx emission intensity was determined by means of one or more stack tests for the purpose of the most recent compliance test referred to in section 38 conducted before that year, other than a most recent compliance test referred to in any of clauses (A) to (C), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for a boiler or heater whose NOx emission intensity is not, for any hour during a year, subject to a limit referred to in any of sections 6, 7, 9 to 11, 13 and 14, that year.

Subsection.Text: The compliance report must be provided by the June 1 following the end of the reporting period.

If the information in respect of a boiler or heater that was provided in a report changes, a change report must be provided to the Minister that identifies the name of the boiler’s or heater’s manufacturer, along with its serial number, make and model, and that contains the updated information, as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a change in information referred to in section 1 or 2 or any of paragraphs 3(a), (b), (d), (e), (i) and (j) of Schedule 6, the changed information within the period that ends 31 days after the change;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a boiler or heater that is permanently taken out of service, an indication to that effect, along with the information referred to in section 1 of Schedule 6, within the period that ends six months after the last day on which it combusted gaseous fossil fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a boiler or heater that is relocated to a facility that is not a regulated facility, an indication to that effect, along with the information referred to in section 1 of Schedule 6, within the period that ends six months after the day on which it was relocated;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for a boiler or heater that is redesigned to no longer combust gaseous fossil fuel, an indication to that effect, along with the information referred to in section 1 of Schedule 6, within the period that ends six months after the last day on which it combusted gaseous fossil fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for a boiler or heater that has a rated capacity of at most 105 GJ/h and that changes the type of gaseous fossil fuel that it combusts from natural gas to alternative gas, or vice versa, the result of a determination under section 25 of its NOx emission intensity made when the type of gaseous fossil fuel combusted was natural gas or alternative gas, whichever type was not combusted during the determination provided in the most recent report before the change, along with, within six months after the end of the reference period,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the determination was made by means of a stack test, the information referred to in subparagraphs 3(k)(i) to (v) of Schedule 6, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the determination was made by means of a CEMS test, the information referred to in subparagraphs 3(l)(i) and (ii) of Schedule 6;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for a boiler or heater that has a rated capacity of at most 105 GJ/h and that undergoes a change involving the installation of equipment to preheat air or, in the case of modern heater, involving the removal of that equipment, the result of a determination under section 25 of its NOx emission intensity made when the boiler or heater operates — with preheated air, if it was not operating with preheated air before the change, or without preheated air, if it was operating with preheated air before the change — along with, within six months after the end of the reference period ,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the determination was made by means of a stack test, the information referred to in paragraph 3(j) and subparagraphs 3(k)(i) to (v) of Schedule 6, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the determination was made by means of a CEMS test, the information referred to in paragraph 3(j) and subparagraphs 3(l)(i) and (ii) of Schedule 6; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for a change in the class of a boiler or heater that results from a redetermination of its classification NOx emission intensity under section 36 or 37, the information referred to in section 1 or 2, paragraphs 3(c) and (e) or any of sections 4 to 8 of Schedule 5, within the period that ends six months after the date on which that redetermination is made.

Subsection.Text: For a change referred to in paragraph (1)(e) or (f), or a subsequent change referred to in subsection (4), the reference period begins on the day on which the boiler or heater begins to combust gaseous fossil fuel after the change and ends on the day that is six months after that day.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Subsequent change of gaseous fossil fuel
Subsection.Text: No matter how many subsequent changes in the type of gaseous fossil fuel combusted — from natural gas to alternative gas, or vice versa — may occur, no further reports are required to be provided after the change report referred to in paragraph (1)(e) is provided.

Despite subsection (3), if a change referred to in paragraph (1)(f) occurs and there is also a subsequent change in the type of gaseous fossil fuel combusted as compared to the type of gaseous fossil fuel combusted during the determination referred to in that paragraph, the result of a determination — under section 25 of the boiler’s or heater’s NOx emission intensity made in the reference period when the type of gaseous fossil fuel combusted was natural gas or alternative gas, whichever type was not combusted during the determination provided in the most recent report before that subsequent change — must be provided to the Minister within six months after the end of the reference period.

Section.Text: Records in respect of a boiler or heater that contain the following information and documents must be made:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the steps, including the relevant dates, that are taken to comply with the operation and maintenance specifications for the boiler or heater set out by its manufacturer or required by its design;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description, including the relevant dates, of any modifications that are made to the design or characteristics of the boiler and heater, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a redesign referred to in subsection 10(2),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a major modification referred to in subsection 13(2),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for a heater, the addition or removal of equipment to preheat air,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the refurbishment of a burner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a modification that results in a change in its thermal efficiency;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the following information necessary to determine the percentage of the input energy in the boiler’s or heater’s combustion chamber that results from the introduction of gaseous fossil fuel in accordance with the formula set out in section 15:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the value determined for each of Eo and Eh is zero, information that establishes that the boiler or heater combusted only gaseous fossil fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, information necessary to determine the value of each of Ecng, Egff, Eo and Eh in that formula; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of a change in fuel from alternative gas to natural gas, or vice versa, including the date and hour of the change, along with supporting documents necessary to determine the value of an element of the formula set out in section 16.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part and in Schedules 8 to 10.

Definition.Text: ASTM D6348-12e1 means the method entitled Standard Test Method for Determination of Gaseous Compounds by Extractive Direct Interface Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR) Spectroscopy, published by ASTM. (méthode ASTM D6348-12e1)

EC Method AP-77-3 means the method entitled Standard Reference Methods for Source Testing: Measurement of Emissions of Nitrogen Oxides from Stationary Sources AP-77-3, published in April 1979 by Her Majesty the Queen in right of Canada, as represented by the Minister. (méthode AP-77-3 d’EC)
emergency means a situation during which an engine is operated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to produce electricity as an alternative source of electrical power when no source that is normally used is available; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to pump water in the event of a fire or flood. (urgence)

Definition.Text: emissions check means a determination in accordance with sections 80 to 84 and 86 to 89 of the concentration of NOx in the exhaust gas of an engine. (vérification des émissions)
engine registry means the engine registry established under section 97. (registre des moteurs)
EPA Method 7 means the method entitled Method 7 — Determination of Nitrogen Oxide Emissions from Stationary Sources, set out in Appendix A-4 to Part 60 of the CFR. (méthode 7 de l’EPA)

EPA Method 7A means the method entitled Method 7A — Determination of Nitrogen Oxide Emissions from Stationary Sources — Ion Chromatographic Method, set out in Appendix A-4 to Part 60 of the CFR. (méthode 7A de l’EPA)

EPA Method 7C means the method entitled Method 7C — Determination of Nitrogen Oxide Emissions from Stationary Sources — Alkaline-Permanganate/Colorimetric Method, set out in Appendix A-4 to Part 60 of the CFR. (méthode 7C de l’EPA)

EPA Method 19 means the method entitled Method 19 — Determination of Sulfur Dioxide Removal Efficiency and Particulate, Sulfur Dioxide and Nitrogen Oxides Emission Rates, set out in Appendix A-7 to Part 60 of the CFR. (méthode 19 de l’EPA)

EPA Method 320 means the method entitled Method 320 — Measurement of Vapor Phase Organic and Inorganic Emissions by Extractive Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR) Spectroscopy, set out in Appendix A to Part 63 of the CFR. (méthode 320 de l’EPA)

group means a notional collection of engines that are designated in accordance with section 56 as belonging to a responsible person’s group and, for the purpose of sections 60 to 68, includes a replacement unit referred to in section 64. (groupe)
lean-burn describes an engine other than a rich-burn engine. (à mélange pauvre)
low-use describes an engine that is referred to in section 50 as being low-use. (à faible utilisation)
modern describes an engine that is referred to in subsection 46(3). (moderne)
NOx emission intensity means the quantity of NOx emitted in the exhaust gas of an engine as represented by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of NOx in the exhaust gas, expressed in ppmvd15%; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the mass of NOx in the exhaust gas per unit of mechanical energy or electrical energy produced, expressed in g/kWh. (intensité d’émission de NOx)

Definition.Text: performance test means a determination, in accordance with sections 70 to 75, of the NOx emission intensity of an engine. (essai de rendement)
ppmvd15% means parts per million, by volume on a dry basis and corrected to 15% oxygen. (ppmvs15%)
pre-existing describes an engine that is referred to in subsection 46(2). (préexistant)
rated brake power means the maximum brake power of an engine or a replacement unit as specified by its manufacturer either on its nameplate or otherwise. (puissance au frein nominale)
regular-use describes an engine referred to in section 50 as being regular-use. (à utilisation régulière)
rich-burn describes an engine for which the oxygen content in the exhaust gas, before any dilution, is less than 4%, determined by volume on a dry basis. (à mélange riche)

SCADA system means a computer system, known as a supervisory control and data acquisition system, that measures an engine or replacement unit’s operating state, manages the parameters controlling its operating state and stores data related to its operating state. (système SCADA)

still gas means a gas that is produced by distillation, cracking or reforming in a petroleum refinery, in an asphalt refinery or in an oil sands facility that is used or designed to engage in the activity of upgrading. (gaz de distillation)
subgroup means a notional collection of pre-existing engines and replacement units that belong to a responsible person’s group established in accordance with section 65. (sous-groupe)
subset means a notional collection of engines that belong to a responsible person’s group described in section 59. (sous-ensemble)
synthetic gas means a gas that is derived from the gasification of coal or from the gasification of by-products, residual products or waste products of an industrial process. (gaz de synthèse)

Subsection.Text: This Part applies in respect of a pre-existing or modern engine, located in a regulated facility, that combusts gaseous fuel.
An engine is pre-existing if one of the following dates is before the 90th day after the day on which these Regulations are registered:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of its manufacture as provided by its manufacturer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a date that is set out in a record of a responsible person for the engine that establishes that the engine was owned or operated on or before that date.

Subsection.Text: An engine is modern if it is not pre-existing.
The following are the regulated facilities in respect of modern engines:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: oil and gas facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: oil sands facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: petroleum refineries;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: chemicals facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: nitrogen-based fertilizer facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: pulp and paper facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: base metals facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: potash facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: alumina facilities and aluminum facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: power plants;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: iron, steel and ilmenite facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: iron ore pelletizing facilities; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: cement manufacturing facilities.

Subsection.Text: Oil and gas facilities, other than asphalt refineries, are the regulated facilities in respect of pre-existing engines.
This Part does not apply in respect of a pre-existing engine for a period of 36 months after the first day on which the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is only one responsible person for the engine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sum of the gross revenue of the responsible person and of each of its affiliates, if any, for the most recent taxation year for which each of them has filed a return of income, does not exceed $5 million;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the total rated brake power of the responsible person’s pre-existing engines is at most 1 MW; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the responsible person provides the Minister with the information referred to in Schedule 8 for inclusion in the engine registry.

Subsection.Text: A period of non-application referred to in subsection (1) is extended by 36 months if, on a day that occurs within the last six months of that period,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the conditions set out in paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the responsible person provides the Minister with the information referred to in Schedule 8 for inclusion in the engine registry.

Subsection.Text: In paragraph (1)(b) and Schedule 8, gross revenue has the same meaning as in section 248 of the Income Tax Act.
In paragraph (1)(b) and Schedule 8, affiliates has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Canada Business Corporations Act.
Subject to subsection (3), this Part does not apply in respect of a pre-existing engine to an owner of it for a period of at most 275 days after the date on which they become its owner, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that date occurs after March 31, 2020; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: before that date, the pre-existing engine has never been equipped with an emission control system that ensures that its NOx emission intensity is at most 525 ppmvd15% or 10 g/kWh.

Subsection.Text: The period of non-application under subsection (1) ends on the first day that is within those 275 days on which the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the engine is equipped with an emission control systems referred to in paragraph (1)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the owner assigns a NOx emission value of at most 525 ppmvd15% or 10 g/kWh to the engine, in the case that they are subject to a limit referred to in section 60; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the owner registers the engine in the engine registry in accordance with subsection 97(3) or (4).

Subsection.Text: There is no period of non-application under subsection (1) if the conditions set out in subsection (2) are not met within those 275 days.

Section.Text: Sections 54, 55, 57 and 58, paragraph 59(1)(b) and section 68 do not apply in respect of an engine — for any period during which the fuel combusted consists of more than 50% synthetic gas, still gas or any combination of those gases — if records are kept that establish, based on a calculation of the mass flow, that the fuel combusted in that period consists of that proportion of those gases.
Every engine that has operated for at least one hour during a year is a regular-use engine unless an election is in effect to have the engine be low-use.

Subsection.Text: The election is made when a responsible person for the engine provides to the Minister a notice of the election for inclusion in the engine registry that specifies the year as of which the election takes effect, which may be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the year in which the notice is provided, if the number of hours that the engine was operating — while they were a responsible person for that engine — in that year before the sending of the notice is recorded; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a year subsequent to the year in which the notice is provided.

Subsection.Text: An engine for which an election is in effect must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have a non-resettable hour meter, another non-resettable device or a SCADA system to determine the number of hours that the engine operates installed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by the day on which the notice is provided, if the election takes effect in the year in which the notice is provided, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by January 1 of the year as of which the election is to take effect, in any other case;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have the meter, device or SCADA system operating continuously, other than during periods when it is undergoing normal servicing or timely repairs, as of the day referred to in subparagraph (a)(i) or (ii), whichever applies;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a non-resettable hour meter or another non-resettable device is installed, have readings taken from the meter or device that are recorded along with the dates of the readings and the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — make and model of the engine within the shortest feasible period before or after

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the notice is provided, if the election takes effect in the year in which the notice is provided,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: every subsequent January 1, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the election ceases to be in effect;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if a SCADA system is installed, have a record made — as of the day referred to in subparagraph (a)(i) or (ii), whichever applies, and until the day on which the election ceases to be in effect — from the SCADA system at least once every 30 days that contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: data, taken every five minutes, that is used to determine the number of hours that the engine has operated,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the dates on which that data was taken, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: data that can be used to identify the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — make and model of the engine; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for each period of three consecutive years that begins with the year as of which the election takes effect, operate, excluding any hour of operation during an emergency, for fewer than 1,314 hours, as determined based on the records referred to in paragraph (c) or (d) and, if applicable, paragraph (1)(a).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Election ceases to be in effect
Subsection.Text: An election ceases to be in effect if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the engine does not meet one of the requirements set out in paragraphs (2)(a) to (e); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a responsible person for the engine provides the Minister with a notice to that effect for inclusion in the engine registry.

Subsection.Text: Nobody who is a responsible person for the engine when an election ceases to be in effect may re-elect to have the engine be low-use before January 1 of the year that begins at least three years after that election took effect.
An engine that is designated by its manufacturer as being a rich-burn engine is presumed to be a rich-burn engine.
The presumption is rebutted if the responsible person for the engine establishes that the oxygen content in the exhaust gas, before any dilution, is at least 4%, determined by volume on a dry basis.

Section.MarginalNote: Applicable units — NOx emission intensity limit
Section.Text: The applicable NOx emission intensity limit for an engine referred to in section 54, 57 or 58 or paragraph 59(1)(b) is the limit that is expressed in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the same units, ppmvd15% or g/kWh, that were used to determine the NOx emission intensity of the engine for the most recent performance test conducted under section 77 or 78; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ppmvd15%, in the absence of a prior performance test or if the units that were used to make the determination for that most recent performance test are not known.

Section.Text: The NOx emission intensity of a modern engine that is regular-use and has a rated brake power of at least 75 kW must not exceed the limit of 160 ppmvd15% or 2.7 g/kWh, whichever applies.
The NOx emission intensity of a modern engine that is low-use and has a rated brake power of at least 100 kW must not exceed the limit of 160 ppmvd15%.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of sections 58 to 68, a responsible person for pre-existing engines that are regular-use and have a rated brake power of at least 250 kW establishes their group by designating which of those engines is to belong to the group.
A responsible person may have at most one group.
An engine is designated as belonging to a responsible person’s group as of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the responsible person became an owner of the engine if, within 90 days after that date, they make a record that contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that date,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine’s serial number or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the engine’s unique alphanumeric identifier,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the record was made, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication that the engine belongs to the group; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the date on which the responsible person makes a record that contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine’s serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the engine’s unique alphanumeric identifier ,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the record was made, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication that the engine belongs to the group.

Subsection.Text: An engine that belongs to a responsible person’s group ceases to belong to the group if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the engine ceases to be a regular-use engine; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the responsible person cancels its designation as belonging to their group by making a record of the engine’s serial number or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the engine’s unique alphanumeric identifier , along with the date of the cancellation.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Deemed not belonging to any group
Subsection.Text: An engine that has been designated as belonging to more than one group is deemed not to belong to any group.

Section.MarginalNote: Engines not belonging to a group
Section.Text: As of January 1, 2021, the NOx emission intensity of a pre-existing engine that is regular-use, has a rated brake power of at least 250 kW and does not belong to any group must not exceed the limit of 210 ppmvd15% or 4 g/kWh, whichever applies.

Section.MarginalNote: Engines belonging to a group after 2025
Section.Text: Subject to section 60, as of January 1, 2026, the NOx emission intensity of an engine that belongs to a group must not exceed the limit of 210 ppmvd15% or 4 g/kWh, whichever applies.

Section.MarginalNote: Engines belonging to a group from 2021 to 2025

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 60, in the period that begins on January 1, 2021 and ends on December 31, 2025, within each group of engines there must be a subset of engines that has the following characteristics:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the total rated brake power of the engines that belong to the subset is at least 50% of the total rated brake power of the engines that belong to the group; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the NOx emission intensity of each engine that belongs to the subset does not exceed the limit of 210 ppmvd15% or 4 g/kWh, whichever applies.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (1)(a), even if an engine that has been registered under subsection 97(3) ceases to belong to the group, its rated brake power may be included in the total rated brake power of both the subset referred to in paragraph (1)(a) and the group.

Heading.TitleText: Yearly Average NOx Emission Intensity Limits — on Election

Section.Text: A responsible person who makes an election in accordance with subsection 61(1) to opt out of the application of section 58 or 59 must — for each year after 2020 that follows the making of the election — ensure that the yearly average NOx emission intensity of each subgroup that they establish under section 65 does not exceed the following limit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 210 ppmvd15% or 4 g/kWh, whichever applies, for years after 2025; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 421 ppmvd15% or 8 g/kWh, whichever applies, for the years 2021 to 2025.

Subsection.Text: The responsible person must — by the October 31 immediately before the first year in respect of which the limit referred to in section 60 is to apply — make the election by providing the Minister with the following information for inclusion in the engine registry for each subgroup that they establish under section 65:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — of each pre-existing engine and replacement unit that belongs to the subgroup; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each NOx emission value, if any, that is assigned under section 67 to a pre-existing engine, or a replacement unit that is a modern engine, that belongs to the subgroup.

Subsection.Text: The yearly average NOx emission intensity of a subgroup for a year is determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the jth NOx emission value, expressed in ppmvd15% or g/kWh, assigned under subsection 66(1) or 67(1) to the ith engine or replacement unit that belongs to the subgroup;
is the rated brake power, expressed in kW, of the ith engine or replacement unit that belongs to the subgroup;
is — excluding any period referred to in section 49 —

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: the number of hours during the year that the ith engine or replacement unit operated while it belonged to the subgroup and had an assigned NOx emission value of Eij, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: the number of days during the year that the ith engine or replacement unit operated at any time during a day while it belonged to the subgroup and had an assigned NOx emission value of Eij, if Tij is determined under this paragraph for all the engines and replacement units that belong to the subgroup;

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the ith engine or replacement unit that belongs to the subgroup, where i goes from 1 to m and where m is the number of those engines and replacement units that belong to the subgroup; and

is the jth assignment under subsection 66(1) or 67(1) of a NOx emission value to the ith engine or replacement unit that belongs to the subgroup, where j goes from 1 to n and where n is the number of assignments of NOx emission values under those subsections to that engine or replacement unit during the year.

Subsection.Text: The number of hours during a year referred to in paragraph (a) of the description of Tij in subsection (2) must be determined

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by means of a non-resettable hour meter, or another non-resettable device, installed on the ith engine or replacement unit to take readings that are recorded along with the dates of the readings and the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — make and model of the engine within the shortest feasible period before or after

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: January 1 of that year,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: January 1 of the year after that year,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of any change in the NOx emission value assigned to the ith engine under subsection 66(1) or 67(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the ith engine or replacement unit is designated as belonging to the subgroup, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the ith engine or replacement unit ceases to belong to the group;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by means of a log of operations used to make a record in respect of the ith engine or replacement unit at least once every 30 days during that year that contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: data related to the number of hours that it has operated on each day since any previous record,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the dates of those days,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its make, model and serial number or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, unique alphanumeric identifier, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the initials of the person making the record; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by means of a SCADA system used to make a record in respect of the ith engine or replacement unit at least once every 30 days during that year that contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: data that is taken every 15 minutes and used to determine the number of hours that it has operated,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the dates on which that data was taken, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: data that can be used to identify its make, model and serial number or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, unique alphanumeric identifier.

Subsection.Text: The non-resettable hour meter, the other non-resettable device or the SCADA system must operate continuously, other than during periods when it is undergoing normal servicing or timely repairs.
A responsible person may revoke their election by providing the Minister with a notice of revocation for inclusion in the engine registry by October 31 of a given year.
As of the first year that begins after the day on which the notice was provided,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the election is revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the limit referred to in section 60 ceases to apply to the responsible person in respect of each subgroup that they establish under section 65; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: section 58 or 59, as the case may be, applies to the responsible person in respect of the engines that belong to their group.

Subsection.Text: An election that is made by a responsible person who is convicted of an offence under the Act in respect of these Regulations is revoked on the January 1 that follows the period of 36 months after their conviction.
As of the revocation,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the limit referred to in section 60 ceases to apply to the responsible person in respect of each subgroup that they established under section 65;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section 58 or 59, as the case may be, applies to the responsible person in respect of the engines that belong to their group; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the responsible person is no longer permitted to make an election under subsection 61(1).

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of section 60, the responsible person may replace in their group any pre-existing engine that ceases to belong to it by an eligible replacement unit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pre-existing engine has operated while it belonged to the group for at least 1,314 hours during the 36 months before the date on which it ceased to belong to the group;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total rated brake power of that replacement unit and the other replacement units that belong to the group is at most the total rated brake power of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that pre-existing engine, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the other pre-existing engines that have been registered by the responsible person in the engine registry under subsection 97(3) and have ceased to belong to the group;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement unit is owned or operated by the responsible person; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement unit is located in an oil and gas facility, other than an asphalt refinery.

Subsection.Text: The following are eligible replacement units:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a modern engine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an electric motor; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a combustion turbine that is equipped with an emission control system that ensures that its NOx emission intensity is at most, as applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 75 ppmvd15% or 1.8 g/kWh, if it is used for mechanical drive and has a rated brake power of less than 4 MW,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 42 ppmvd15% or 1.0 g/kWh, if it is used for electricity generation and has a rated brake power of less than 4 MW,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 ppmvd15% or 0.5 g/kWh, if it has a rated brake power of at least 4 MW and at most 70 MW, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 15 ppmvd15% or 0.3 g/kWh, if it has a rated brake power of more than 70 MW.

Subsection.Text: A replacement unit that no longer meets a condition that is set out in paragraph (1)(c) or (d) ceases to belong to the responsible person’s group.

The replacement of the pre-existing engine by the replacement unit takes effect on the day on which the responsible person provides the Minister with the following information for inclusion in the engine registry:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the pre-existing engine ceased to belong to their group; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in sections 1 to 3 of Schedule 9 in respect of the pre-existing engine and the replacement unit.

Subsection.Text: A pre-existing engine that has been replaced may be reintroduced into the responsible person’s group if replacement units — having a total rated brake power that is at least the rated brake power of the engine — are removed from the group.
A responsible person who is subject to a limit set out in section 60 must establish one or more subgroups by, for each subgroup,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: assigning an identifier to it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: designating — from among the pre-existing engines and replacement units that belong to their group — those that are to belong to that subgroup; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: selecting the units, ppmvd15% or g/kWh, that are to be used to express the NOx emission value of the pre-existing engines and replacement units that belong to that subgroup.

Subsection.Text: Each pre-existing engine and replacement unit that belongs to their group must be included in exactly one subgroup.
An engine or replacement unit is designated as belonging to the subgroup as of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the responsible person became an owner of the engine if, within 90 days after that date, they make a record that contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that date,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the identifier of the subgroup,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine’s serial number or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the engine’s unique alphanumeric identifier , and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the record was made; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the date on which the responsible person makes a record that contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the identifier of the subgroup,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — of the engine or replacement unit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the record was made.

Subsection.Text: For each of those designations, the responsible person must, by July 1 of the year after the year that includes the date of the designation, provide the Minister with the information that is contained in the record described in paragraph (3)(a) or (b) for inclusion in the engine registry.

Section.MarginalNote: Assignment of default NOx emission value

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 67, the applicable default NOx emission value that is set out in subsection (2) is assigned to a pre-existing engine or replacement unit that belongs to a subgroup of a responsible person who is subject to a limit set out in section 60.

The default NOx emission value — expressed in the same units, ppmvd15% or g/kWh, that are selected under paragraph 65(1)(c) for the subgroup to which the pre-existing engine or replacement unit belongs — is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a pre-existing four-stroke lean-burn engine,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 210 ppmvd15% or 4 g/kWh, if

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the oxygen content in its exhaust gas, before any dilution, is at least 7%, determined by volume on a dry basis while the engine is operating but not during start-up, shutdown or a period of malfunction,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the responsible person has a record of the information referred to in paragraph 100(i) and section 6 of Schedule 10 in respect of the most recent performance test conducted on the engine and the emission intensity of the engine, as determined by that most recent performance test, is at most 210 ppmvd15% or 4 g/kWh, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the responsible person has

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: registered the engine under subsection 97(3), and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: indicated in the engine registry that this default NOx emission value applies to the engine, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 710 ppmvd15% or 13.5 g/kWh, in any other case;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a pre-existing two-stroke lean-burn engine, 841 ppmvd15% or 16 g/kWh;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a pre-existing rich-burn engine, 1,262 ppmvd15% or 24 g/kWh;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for a replacement unit that is a modern engine, 160 ppmvd15% or 2.7 g/kWh;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for a replacement unit that is an electric motor, 0 ppmvd15% or 0 g/kWh; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for a replacement unit that is a combustion turbine,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 75 ppmvd15% or 1.8 g/kWh, if it is used for mechanical drive and has a rated brake power of less than 4 MW,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 42 ppmvd15% or 1.0 g/kWh, if it is used for electricity generation and has a rated brake power of less than 4 MW,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 ppmvd15% or 0.5 g/kWh, if it has a rated brake power of at least 4 MW and at most 70 MW, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 15 ppmvd15% or 0.3 g/kWh, if it has a rated brake power of more than 70 MW.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1) and subparagraph (2)(a)(i), the default NOx emission value referred to in that subparagraph is, under subsection (1), assigned to a pre-existing four-stroke lean-burn engine on the date on which the responsible person for the engine became its owner, if the conditions described in clauses (2)(a)(i)(A) to (C) are met in respect of the engine and that responsible person at most 90 days after that date.

Section.MarginalNote: Assignment of non-default NOx emission value

Subsection.Text: A NOx emission value that is different from the default NOx emission value set out in subsection 66(2) may be assigned to a pre-existing engine, or a replacement unit that is a modern engine, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its NOx emission intensity — determined by means of the most recent performance test conducted on the engine and expressed in the same units, ppmvd15% or g/kWh, that are selected under paragraph 65(1)(c) for the subgroup to which the engine belongs — does not exceed that different NOx emission value; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the responsible person referred to in subsection 66(1) has registered the engine under subsection 97(3) and provides the Minister with that different NOx emission value for inclusion in the engine registry.

Subsection.Text: The assignment takes effect as of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the responsible person became an owner of the engine if, within 90 days after that date, they provide the Minister with the assigned NOx emission value of the engine for inclusion in the engine registry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the responsible person provides the Minister with the assigned NOx emission value for inclusion in the engine registry, in any other case.

Section.MarginalNote: NOx emission intensity limit — non-default NOx emission values
Section.Text: A responsible person who assigns a NOx emission value to an engine that is different from its default NOx emission value must, as of that assignment, ensure that its NOx emission intensity — expressed in the same units, ppmvd15% or g/kWh, that are selected under paragraph 65(1)(c) for the subgroup to which the engine belongs — does not exceed a limit that is that different NOx emission value.
For the purpose of sections 54, 55, 57 and 58, paragraph 59(1)(b) and section 68, the NOx emission intensity of an engine must be determined by means of a performance test.

Subsection.Text: A performance test consists of three consecutive test runs conducted within the same day, each of which lasts at least 20 minutes and results in a determination of the engine’s NOx emission intensity.
Each test run must be conducted while the engine is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: operating at the lower of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 90% or more of its rated brake power, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its highest achievable brake power for the operating conditions during the test run; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not operating during start-up, shutdown or a period of malfunction.

Subsection.Text: The location of the sampling port, and its traverse points, in the exhaust pipe for each test run must be determined in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 1 or EPA Method 1A, as applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ASTM D6522-11; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: EC Method A.

Subsection.Text: If a pre-existing engine does not have a sampling port that meets the requirements of any of those methods, each test run must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be conducted at a single traverse point that is located at the centre of the exhaust pipe at a distance from the engine of at least twice the diameter of that pipe; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have the NOx emission intensity of the engine expressed in ppmvd15%.

Subsection.Text: If an after-treatment control device is used, either

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the location of the sampling port described by subsection (1) must also be downstream of the device; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of paragraph (2)(a), the location of the single traverse point must be downstream of the device — rather than the engine — at a distance from the device of at least twice the diameter of the exhaust pipe.

Subsection.Text: The concentration of NOx in the engine’s exhaust gas for each test run must be determined in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 7;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 7A;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 7C;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 7E;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 320;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ASTM D6348-12e1;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: ASTM D6522-11; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: EC Method AP-77-3.

Subsection.Text: The concentration of O2 in the engine’s exhaust gas for each test run must be determined in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the EPA method entitled Method 3 — Gas Analysis for the Determination of Dry Molecular Weight, set out in Appendix A-2 to Part 60 of the CFR;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 3A;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the EPA method entitled Method 3B — Gas Analysis for the Determination of Emission Rate Correction Factor or Excess Air, set out in Appendix A-2 to Part 60 of the CFR;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: ASTM D6522-11; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method entitled Flue and Exhaust Gas Analyses, published by the American Society of Mechanical Engineers and cited as ASME PTC 19.10-1981.

Subsection.Text: For each test run, if the concentration of NOx in the engine’s exhaust gas is measured on a wet basis or if the NOx emission intensity of the engine is to be expressed in g/kWh, the moisture content in that gas must be determined in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 4;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 320;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: ASTM D6348-12e1; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: EC Method D.

Subsection.Text: If the NOx emission intensity of the engine is to be expressed in g/kWh, the volumetric flow rate of the engine’s exhaust gas must be expressed in m3/h, at 25°C and 101.325 kPa, and be determined in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: EPA Method 19; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: EC Method B.

Subsection.Text: For each test run, the following measurements must be taken simultaneously at the same traverse point in accordance with section 71:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of NOx in the engine’s exhaust gas;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of O2 in the engine’s exhaust gas;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the moisture content in the engine’s exhaust gas, if applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the volumetric flow rate of the engine’s exhaust gas, if applicable.

Section.Text: If the NOx emission intensity of the engine is to be expressed in ppmvd15%, it must be determined for each test run by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the concentration of NOx in the engine’s exhaust gas, expressed in ppmvd, determined at a given percentage of oxygen (%O2) in accordance with subsection 72(1); and

is the number that represents the percentage of oxygen in the engine’s exhaust gas as determined by volume on a dry basis, based on the concentration of O2 determined in accordance with subsection 72(2).

Subsection.Text: If the NOx emission intensity of the engine is to be expressed in g/kWh, it must be determined for each test run by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the concentration of NOx in the engine’s exhaust gas, expressed in parts per million by volume, determined at a given percentage of oxygen (%O2) in accordance with subsection 72(1);
is the volumetric flow rate of the engine’s exhaust gas, expressed in m3/h, determined in accordance with subsection 72(4);
is the duration of the test run, expressed in hours to two decimal places; and
is the brake work of the engine during the test run, expressed in kWh.

Subsection.Text: The elements C and Q described in subsection (1) must be expressed on the same basis, whether wet or dry.

Section.Text: The NOx emission intensity of the engine determined by means of a performance test is the average of the three determinations — one for each test run — of its NOx emission intensity.
The average described in section 75 is deemed to be the NOx emission intensity of the engine

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the day on which the performance test is conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for every subsequent day until its NOx emission intensity is determined based on another performance test.

Section.Text: In addition to a performance test referred to in section 69, a performance test to determine the NOx emission intensity, expressed in ppmvd15% or g/kWh, of a regular-use engine must be conducted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within 12 months after the first hour of its operation after it first becomes a regular-use engine, if it is a modern engine that has a rated brake power of at least 75 kW;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: within 12 months after any of sections 57 to 59 first applies in respect of the engine;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: within 90 days after a person becomes, on a given date, an owner of an engine that is subject to a NOx emission intensity limit referred to in any of sections 54 and 57 to 59, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they do not have a record of the information referred to in paragraph 100(i) and section 6 of Schedule 10 in respect of the most recent performance test, if any, conducted on the engine, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that given date occurs

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: less than 90 days before the end of the 12-month period referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: after the end of that 12-month period; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: before an assignment, by a responsible person under subsection 67(1), of a NOx emission value to an engine that is different from its default NOx emission value described in subsection 66(2), if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the NOx emission value that they propose to assign is lower than the NOx emission intensity for the engine determined by means of the most recent performance test conducted on the engine, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that responsible person does not have a record of the information referred to in paragraph 100(i) and section 6 of Schedule 10 in respect of that most recent performance test.

Section.Text: An engine with a rated brake power of at least 375 kW on which a performance test has been conducted under section 77 or this section must have a subsequent performance test conducted to determine its NOx emission intensity, expressed in ppmvd15% or g/kWh,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a lean-burn engine, by the earlier of the completion of 17,520 hours of operation since the most recent of those performance tests and 36 months after that most recent performance test; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a rich-burn engine,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by the earlier of the completion of 8,760 hours of operation since the most recent of those performance tests and 36 months after that most recent performance test, if the concentration of NOx in the exhaust gas has been determined — under section 89 for at least one emissions check conducted in each 90-day period in accordance with paragraph 79(b) — not to exceed the NOx emission intensity limit, expressed in ppmvd15%, applicable to the engine, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by the earlier of the completion of 4,380 hours of operation since the most recent of those performance tests and nine months after that most recent performance test, in any other case.

Section.MarginalNote: When emissions check required for certain engines
Section.Text: An emissions check to determine the concentration of NOx in the exhaust gas must be conducted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on a lean-burn engine with a rated brake power of at least 375 kW,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: within 365 days after the assignment of a default emission value under subsection 66(1), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: within 365 days after the most recent performance test conducted on the engine under section 77 or 78 or the most recent emissions check conducted on the engine under this section; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on a rich-burn engine referred to in subparagraph 78(b)(i), within 90 days after the most recent performance test conducted on the engine under section 77 or 78 or the most recent emissions check conducted on the engine under this section.

Subsection.Text: An emissions check must be conducted by means of an electrochemical analyzer.
The electrochemical analyzer must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be capable of simultaneously measuring the concentrations, in an engine’s exhaust gas, of each of the following gases by means of an electrochemical cell for each of those gases:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: O2, CO and NO, for

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a rich-burn engine that is equipped with a three-way catalyst, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an engine whose NOx in the exhaust gas consists of at most 10% NO2, based on the results of the most recent performance test conducted on it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: O2, CO, NO and NO2, in any other case;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have a resolution, as specified by its manufacturer, that is at most

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 1 ppm, for CO, NO and, if applicable, NO2, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.1%, for O2; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be equipped with a device that monitors the temperature of the NO electrochemical cell.

Section.MarginalNote: Calibration error checks and interference responses
Section.Text: Before an electrochemical analyzer is used for the first time to conduct an emissions check on an engine,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an initial sequence of calibration error checks must be conducted on the cells of the analyzer in accordance with section 83; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an initial determination of the CO and NO interference responses of the cells of the analyzer must be conducted in accordance with section 84 for each of the calibration error checks in the sequence.

Subsection.Text: An electrochemical analyzer must be operated and maintained in accordance with the manufacturer’s specifications, including the specifications on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: introducing gas into the analyzer at a constant flow rate within the range specified by the manufacturer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: rinsing the analyzer with fresh air for the period recommended by the manufacturer between each introduction of gas into the analyzer.

Subsection.Text: Before a calibration error check or an emissions check is conducted in a given location,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the measurement system must be verified to have no leaks;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the measurement system must be verified to have sufficient scrubbing agent in good working order to conduct the check;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: after those verifications, the analyzer must be turned on at that location for the longer of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 20 minutes, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the period that is necessary for the temperature of the NO electrochemical cell to be within 2°C of ambient air temperature; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: after the end of the applicable period described in paragraph (c), the analyzer must be zeroed at that location by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: using the zeroing function of the analyzer, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: turning it off and on.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Analyzer — measurement system for introduction of gas
Subsection.Text: The measurement system for the introduction of gas into the analyzer must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: remove condensation continuously from that gas by means of a chilled condenser or similar device; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be non-reactive with NO2.

Subsection.Text: A sequence of calibration error checks consists of two calibration error checks on each of the electrochemical cells of an analyzer, one involving the introduction of a zero gas and the other involving the introduction of a span gas.

A calibration error check on an electrochemical cell of an analyzer is conducted by introducing into the analyzer, at a constant flow rate, a calibration gas — namely, a zero gas or a span gas — for each of the gases referred to in subsection (3) to which that cell is designed to respond in order to determine the difference between

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of that gas in that calibration gas, as indicated by the reading of that cell’s response to it taken after the stabilization period for the calibration error check for that cell, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the certified concentration of that gas in that calibration gas.

Subsection.Text: The zero gas and the span gas for the following gases to which a cell is designed to respond are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for O2,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a zero gas that consists of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: O2 in nitrogen, with a certified concentration of O2 of less than 0.25% of the concentration of O2 in its corresponding span gas,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: CO in nitrogen, or in air, with a certified concentration of O2 of less than 0.05%, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: NO in nitrogen, with a certified concentration of O2 of less than 0.05%, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a span gas that consists of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: ambient air in a well-ventilated area, with a presumed certified concentration of 20.9% O2, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: O2 in nitrogen that has a certified concentration of O2 that is

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: within the measuring range, specified by the analyzer’s manufacturer, for the O2 cell, and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: at least 5% and at most 20.9%;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for CO,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a zero gas that consists of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: ambient air in a well-ventilated area, with a presumed certified concentration of 0 ppm CO, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: CO in nitrogen, or in air, with a certified concentration of CO of less than 0.25% of the concentration of CO in its corresponding span gas, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a span gas that consists of CO in nitrogen, or in air, with a certified concentration of CO that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: within the measuring range, specified by the analyzer’s manufacturer, for the CO cell, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: at least 200 ppm and at most 400 ppm;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for NO,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a zero gas that consists of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: ambient air in a well-ventilated area, with a presumed certified concentration of 0 ppm NO, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: NO in nitrogen, with a certified concentration of NO of less than 0.25% of the concentration of NO in its corresponding span gas, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a span gas that consists of NO in nitrogen, with a certified concentration of NO that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: within the measuring range, specified by the analyzer’s manufacturer, for the NO cell, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: at least 100 ppm and at most 200 ppm; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for NO2,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a zero gas that consists of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: ambient air in a well-ventilated area, with a presumed certified concentration of 0 ppm NO2, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: NO2 in air with a certified concentration of NO2 of less than 0.25% of the concentration of NO2 in its corresponding span gas, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a span gas that consists of NO2 in air, with a certified concentration of NO2 that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: within the measuring range, specified by the analyzer’s manufacturer, for the NO2 cell, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: at least 50 ppm and at most 100 ppm.

Subsection.Text: A concentration of O2, CO, NO or NO2 in a calibration gas is certified if the manufacturer of the gas certifies that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the concentration of that gas in the calibration gas is accurate within ± 2%; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the calibration gas was prepared and analyzed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with section 2 of method entitled EPA Traceability Protocol for Assay and Certification of Gaseous Calibration Standards, published in May 2012 and bearing the designation EPA/600/R-12/531, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by means of a process for measuring that concentration and for verifying its accuracy in accordance with specifications and standards of the National Institute of Standards and Technology of the United States.

Subsection.Text: The stabilization period for a sequence of calibration error checks on an analyzer is the longest period among the periods required for each electrochemical cell to have a stable response, following the introduction of a span gas into the analyzer, to the gas to which the cell is designed to respond. The duration of each of those periods must be recorded.
The calibration error — for each calibration error check involving the introduction of the zero gas or of the span gas — must be at most

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for O2, 0.5%; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for CO, NO or NO2, the greater of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 5% of the certified concentration of that gas in the span gas, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 ppm.

Section.MarginalNote: Reading for CO and NO interference responses

Subsection.Text: When a reading of an electrochemical cell’s response to a span gas for NO or NO2 is taken under subsection 83(1), a reading must also be taken — for the purpose of determining the CO and NO interference responses — of the response of the following other cells of the analyzer to that span gas:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a span gas for NO, the CO cell; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a span gas for NO2, the CO and NO cells.

Subsection.Text: The CO interference response — namely, the response of the CO cell to the presence of NO and NO2 in the introduced span gas — is the percentage determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the CO response to span gas for NO, expressed in ppm of CO;
is the certified concentration of NO in the span gas for NO, expressed in ppm of NO;

is the concentration of NO in the exhaust gas of the engine, as determined in accordance with section 89 for the most recent emissions check that was conducted by means of the analyzer referred to in subsection (1), expressed in ppm of NO;
is the concentration of CO in the exhaust gas of the engine, as determined in accordance with section 89 for that most recent emissions check, expressed in ppm of CO;
is the CO response to span gas for NO2, expressed in ppm of CO;
is the certified concentration of NO2 in the span gas for NO2, expressed in ppm of NO2; and
is the concentration of NO2 in the exhaust gas of the engine, as determined in accordance with section 89 for that most recent emissions check, expressed in ppm of NO2.

Subsection.Text: The NO interference response — namely, the response of the NO cell to the presence of NO2 in the introduced span gas — is the percentage determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the NO response to span gas for NO2, expressed in ppm of NO;
is the certified concentration of NO2 in the span gas for NO2, expressed in ppm of NO2;

is the concentration of NO2 in the exhaust gas of the engine, as determined in accordance with section 89 for the most recent emissions check that was conducted by means of the analyzer referred to in subsection (1), expressed in ppm of NO2; and
is the concentration of NOx in the exhaust gas of the engine, as determined in accordance with section 89 for that most recent emissions check, expressed in ppm of NOx.

Subsection.Text: If there is no prior emissions check conducted by means of the analyzer referred to in subsection (1),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the value of CNOS, CCOS and CNO2S referred to in subsection (2) or (3) is the certified concentration of NO, CO and NO2, respectively, in the span gas for that gas, expressed in ppm of that gas; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the value of CNOxS referred to in subsection (3) is the total of the certified concentrations of NO and NO2 in the span gas for NO and NO2, respectively, expressed in ppm of NOx.

Subsection.Text: The CO interference response and the NO interference response must each be at most 5%.

Section.MarginalNote: Invalid emissions check — calibration and interference
Section.Text: If a calibration error check on a cell of an analyzer does not meet the requirements of subsection 83(6) or a determination — based on the readings taken during a sequence of calibration error checks that includes that calibration error check — of the CO interference response made under subsection 84(2), or of the NO interference response made under subsection 84(3), is more than 5%,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any emissions check that is conducted with the analyzer, since the most recent sequence of calibration error checks on the analyzer, is invalid; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no emissions check that is conducted with the analyzer is valid until

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a sequence of calibration error checks on its cells is conducted for which each calibration error check meets the requirements of subsection 83(6), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a determination — based on the readings taken during that sequence — of at most 5% is made in accordance with subsections 84(2) and 84(3) of the CO interference response and of the NO interference response, respectively.

Subsection.Text: The location in the exhaust pipe of the sampling port and its traverse points — or the single traverse point — at which an emissions check is to be conducted must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the same as the location of the sampling port or the single traverse point that is used for the most recent performance test conducted, if that port or point continues to be available; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: determined in accordance with section 71, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: A single traverse point at the centre of the exhaust pipe at the sampling port may be used to take samples instead of multiple traverse points.

Section.Text: The emissions check must be conducted while the engine is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: operating with a rated brake power

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that is at most 10% below the brake power at which it operated most of the time during the previous 90 days, if that brake power during that time is at least 50% of its rated brake power, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that is at least 40% of its rated brake power, in any other case; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not operating during start-up, shutdown or a period of malfunction.

Subsection.Text: The emissions check must be conducted — on an engine’s exhaust gas introduced into the analyzer at a constant flow rate — during a 15-minute sampling period by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: taking a reading of each of its electrochemical cells’ responses to, as applicable, O2, CO, NO and NO2 in the exhaust gas at least once each minute during that period and at least 15 seconds after a previous reading; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: recording the average, over each minute of that period, of each of those cells’ responses to, as applicable, O2, CO, NO and NO2 in the exhaust gas.

Subsection.Text: If the emissions check is conducted with an analyzer that does not display negative concentrations, the NO cell temperature must be recorded at least once each minute during the 15-minute sampling period.

The sampling period begins after the end of the period that begins with the introduction of the engine’s exhaust gas into the analyzer for the emissions check and that has a duration determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the stabilization period, expressed in seconds, referred to in subsection 83(5) for the most recent sequence of calibration error checks conducted on the analyzer;

is the greatest diameter, expressed in m, of any tube that is used in the measurement system through which the engine’s exhaust gas flows from the sampling port or traverse point to the analyzer during the emissions check;
is the total length, expressed in m, of those tubes that are used during the emissions check;
is the flow rate, expressed in m3/s, of the engine’s exhaust gas measured by the analyzer during the emissions check;

is the smallest diameter, expressed in m, of any tube that is used in the measurement system through which the span gas flows from the point where it is introduced into the measurement system to the analyzer during the most recent sequence of calibration error checks conducted on the analyzer;
is the total length, expressed in m, of those tubes that are used during the most recent sequence of calibration error checks conducted on the analyzer; and
is the flow rate, expressed in m3/s, of the span gas for NO measured by the analyzer during the most recent sequence of calibration error checks conducted on the analyzer.

Section.MarginalNote: Concentration of O2, CO, NO and NO2 — average

Subsection.Text: The concentration of O2, CO, NO and NO2, as the case may be, in the exhaust gas determined by the emissions check is the average of the concentrations of the gas in each reading taken or recording made in accordance with subsection 88(1).
The concentration of NOx in the exhaust gas, expressed in ppmvd15%, must be determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the sum of the concentrations of NO and NO2 in the engine’s exhaust gas as determined in accordance with subsection (1), expressed in ppmvd, at the concentration of O2, determined in accordance with that subsection; and
is the number that represents the percentage of oxygen in the engine’s exhaust gas based on the concentration of O2 determined in accordance with that subsection.

Subsection.Text: If there is a difference of more than 3°C between any two NO cell temperatures that are recorded in accordance with subsection 88(2), the emissions check in question and any concentration that is determined in accordance with section 89 are invalid.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Invalid emissions check — cell measuring range
Subsection.Text: If any reading taken of an electrochemical cell’s response, or recording that is made of the average of the responses of that cell, in accordance with subsection 88(1) during an emissions check with an analyzer to determine a concentration in accordance with section 89 is outside the measuring range for that cell specified by the analyzer’s manufacturer,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the emissions check and any concentration that is determined in accordance with that section are invalid; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no emissions check that is conducted with the analyzer is valid until

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a sequence of calibration error checks on its cells is conducted for which each calibration error check meets the requirements of subsection 83(6), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a determination — based on the readings taken during that sequence — of at most 5% is made in accordance with subsections 84(2) and (3) of the CO interference response and of the NO interference response, respectively.

Section.Text: A performance test or an emissions check must not be conducted during any period referred to in section 49.

Despite any of paragraphs 77(a) to (c) or section 78 or 79, a person who becomes an owner of an engine — on a date during the last 90 days of the period for conducting a performance test or emissions check on the engine referred to in that provision with no performance test or emissions check on the engine having yet been conducted in that period — may conduct the performance test or emissions check within a period of 90 days after that date.

Despite any of paragraphs 77(a) to (c) or section 78, 79 or 92, a performance test or emissions check that is referred to in that provision and that has not been conducted by the last day of the period for conducting the performance test or emissions check referred to in that provision must be conducted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if that last day occurs in a period referred to in section 49 or a period when the engine is not operating, on the first day that occurs that is not in either of those periods; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if that last day occurs in a period while an election to have the engine be low-use is in effect, on or by the day, if any, after that period ends.

Subsection.Text: An engine that is low-use or that is subject to a NOx emission intensity limit referred to in any of sections 54 and 57 to 59 — or an engine or replacement unit that belongs to a subgroup — must have a nameplate that is permanently affixed to it in a visible location and that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its serial number or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, its unique alphanumeric identifier referred to in subsection (3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its make and model; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its rated brake power.

Subsection.Text: The serial number must be the serial number provided by the engine or replacement unit’s manufacturer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the original nameplate affixed to it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as engraved on the original crankcase; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: as set out in a document that is provided by its manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: If the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the responsible person for a pre-existing engine or a replacement unit that is not a modern engine may apply to the Minister for a unique alphanumeric identifier for the engine or replacement unit by providing the Minister with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in Schedule 9, other than the engine’s or replacement unit’s serial number or unique alphanumeric identifier; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the reason why the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse the application if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has provided false or misleading information in the application.

The recommendations of the manufacturer concerning the operation and maintenance of the systems and components referred to in subsection (2) that are related to an engine must be treated as requirements and be complied with,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an engine that is subject to a NOx emission intensity limit referred to in any of sections 54, 55 and 57, by a responsible person for the engine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an engine that is subject to a NOx emission intensity limit referred to in section 58 or 59, by the responsible person who has established the group to which the engine belongs; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an engine that belongs to a subgroup, other than a pre-existing engine that has been assigned a default NOx emission value referred to in subparagraph 66(2)(a)(ii) or paragraph 66(2)(b) or (c), by the responsible person who has established the group to which the engine belongs.

Subsection.Text: The following are the systems and components:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ignition system, including spark plugs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the air-fuel ratio management system;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the NOx, O2 and lambda sensors;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the lubrication system, including the oil and oil filters;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the air intake filtration system; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the after-treatment control device.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), no recommendation referred to in that subsection need be treated as a requirement and complied with by the responsible person described in that subsection if they have a record that establishes that without that compliance the NOx emission intensity of the engine is unlikely to exceed the following limit or value:
