Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicable NOx emission intensity limit referred to in sections 54, 55, 57 and 58;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an engine that belongs to the subset referred to in subsection 59(1), the applicable NOx emission intensity limit referred to in that subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an engine that belongs to a subgroup, the NOx emission value that is assigned to the engine under

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subsection 66(1), if that emission value is 210 ppmvd15% or 4 g/kWh, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subsection 67(1).

Section.Text: The responsible person described in subsection 95(1) must verify, maintain and adjust the air-fuel ratio of the engine so as to ensure that its NOx emission intensity, during the diverse ambient conditions anticipated during a year, does not exceed the following limit or value:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicable NOx emission intensity limit referred to in sections 54, 55, 57 and 58;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an engine that belongs to the subset referred to in subsection 59(1), the applicable NOx emission intensity limit referred to in that subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an engine that belongs to a subgroup, the NOx emission value assigned to the engine under

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subsection 66(1), if that emission value is 210 ppmvd15% or 4 g/kWh, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subsection 67(1).

Heading.TitleText: Registry, Reporting and Recording of Information

Subsection.Text: The Minister is to establish an engine registry in order to carry out the purpose of this Part by facilitating the provision to the Minister of information that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: necessary to know whether this Part applies in respect of an engine; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: related to the requirements referred to in section 60 that are imposed on engines that belong to a subgroup.

Subsection.Text: The following engines must be registered in the engine registry:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a modern engine with a rated brake power of at least 75 kW that is regular-use or low-use; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pre-existing engine with a rated brake power of at least 250 kW that is regular-use or low-use.

Subsection.Text: A responsible person for a regular-use engine that they have designated as belonging to their group must register the engine on or before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: January 1, 2019, if the designation occurs before that date; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: July 1 of the year that follows the year during which the engine is designated as belonging to the group, if the designation occurs on or after January 1, 2019.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Registration date — engines not in group
Subsection.Text: An engine referred to in subsection (2) that does not belong to a group must be registered on or before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a pre-existing engine, the later of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: January 1, 2019, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: July 1 of the year that follows the first year during which there is a responsible person for the engine, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a modern engine, July 1 of the year that follows the first year during which there is a responsible person for the engine.

Subsection.Text: An engine that has been registered in accordance with subsection (4) — or re-registered under this subsection — must be re-registered on or before July 1 of the year that follows the last year during which there remains at least one responsible person for the engine who has registered or re-registered the engine.
The registration occurs when the Minister is provided with the information for inclusion in the engine registry in respect of the engine that is set out in Schedule 9.

If there is a change in the information provided to the Minister for inclusion in the engine registry in respect of an engine or a replacement unit, the Minister must be provided with the updated information

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within 30 days after the place where a record is kept is changed, if the updated information involves a change in the place where a record is kept; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on or before July 1 of the year that follows the year during which the change occurred but before a compliance report in respect of that year is provided to the Minister, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: The updated information must be provided by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the responsible person referred to in subsection 97(3), if the updated information is in respect of an engine referred to in that subsection or in respect of a replacement unit referred to in subsection 64(4); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a responsible person who has registered or re-registered the engine in the engine registry in accordance with subsection 97(4) or (5), if the updated information is in respect of an engine referred to in that subsection.

Subsection.Text: A compliance report must, on or before July 1 of a year, be provided that contains the information set out in Schedule 10 in respect of the preceding year to the Minister in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an engine or replacement unit that, during the preceding year, belongs to a subgroup; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an engine that, during the preceding year,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is subject to a NOx emission intensity limit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is low-use; or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: combusts fuel for a period referred to in section 49.

Subsection.Text: The compliance report must be provided by the responsible person for the engine or replacement unit who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provided updated information in accordance with paragraph 98(2)(a) in respect of an engine or replacement unit referred to in that paragraph, if that updated information was provided;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provided updated information in accordance with paragraph 98(2)(b) in respect of an engine referred to in that paragraph, if that updated information was provided; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: registered the engine in the engine registry in accordance with subsection 97((3) or (4) or re-registered it in the engine registry in accordance with subsection 97(5), in any other case.

Section.Text: In addition to any records otherwise required under these Regulations, a record in respect of an engine or replacement unit that contains the following information or documents must be made:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the engine is equipped with an emission control system after March 31, 2020, information that establishes that the engine is so equipped, along with the date on which it was equipped;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the calculation of the mass flow for each period referred to in section 49, along with the dates on which the period begins and ends;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each low-use engine, the following information concerning any period of operation during an emergency referred to in paragraph 51(2)(e):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the dates on which the period begins and ends,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its duration, in hours, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of whether paragraph (a) or (b), or both, of the definition emergency set out in section 45 describes that operation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for each pre-existing engine with a rated brake power of at least 250 kW that ceases to be a regular-use engine, the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — of the engine and the date of that cessation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information that establishes the date referred to in paragraph 56(3)(a) or 65(3)(a), subsection 66(3), paragraph 67(2)(a) or 77(c) or section 92 on which the responsible person referred to in that paragraph, subsection or section became an owner of the engine;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for each engine designated as belonging to a group, the information referred to in paragraph 56(3)(a) or (b);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for each engine that has had its designation as belonging to a group cancelled under paragraph 56(4)(b), the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — of the engine and the date of the cancellation;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for each pre-existing engine or replacement unit belonging to a subgroup, the information referred to in paragraph 65(3)(a) or (b);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: for each performance test referred to in clause 66(2)(a)(i)(B) or section 77, 78, 92 or 93 that is conducted on the engine,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the performance test was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the person who conducted the performance test and, if that person is a corporation, the name of the individual who conducted the performance test, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for each test run in the performance test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the brake power of the engine while the test run was conducted and the measurements and calculations used to determine that brake power, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the NOx emission intensity of the engine that was determined for that test run and the measurements and calculations that were used to make that determination;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: for each emissions check that is conducted under section 79, 92 or 93,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the make, model and serial number of the analyzer that was used,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the emissions check was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — of the engine on which the emissions check was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the person who conducted the emissions check and, if that person is a corporation, the name of the individual who conducted the emissions check,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an estimate of the brake power of the engine while the emissions check was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: for each minute of the sampling period for the emissions check referred to in subsection 88(1),

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: each NO cell temperature that was recorded, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: each reading of an electrochemical cell’s response to a concentration, or recording of the average of those responses, of O2, CO, NO and NO2 in the engine’s exhaust gas, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the flow rate of the engine’s exhaust gas that was measured by the analyzer during the emissions check;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: for any electrochemical analyzer used to conduct a sequence of calibration error checks or an emissions check,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the serial number, make and model of the electrochemical analyzer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a log of operations and maintenance of the electrochemical analyzer;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: for each sequence of calibration error checks of an analyzer that are conducted under section 83,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the serial number, make and model of the analyzer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the sequence was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the certified concentration of each zero gas and of each span gas for O2, CO, NO or NO2,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the stabilization periods recorded under subsection 83(5) for each cell’s response — following the introduction of a span gas for O2, CO, NO or NO2 into the analyzer — to the gas to which the cell is designed to respond,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the reading of each cell’s response to a calibration gas referred to in subsection 83(2),

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the calibration error described in subsection 83(6), for each zero gas and span gas for, as applicable, O2, CO, NO or NO2,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the flow rate of each span gas that is measured by the analyzer during the sequence,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the reading of the response referred to in subsection 84(1) for the CO cell and NO cell, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the CO interference response that is determined under subsection 84(2) and the NO interference response that is determined under subsection 84(3);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: if a performance test or emissions check was conducted on the engine under paragraph 93(a), information that establishes that it was not operating for each day in the period of its non-operation referred to in that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: a log of operations and maintenance of the systems and components related to the engine that are set out in subsection 95(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: for each engine referred to in subsection 95(1), the type of equipment or method used to control the air-fuel ratio of the engine, and how that ratio was verified and maintained or adjusted, during the diverse ambient conditions in each year, so as to ensure that its NOx emission intensity does not exceed the NOx emission intensity limit or NOx emission value referred to in section 96.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part and in Schedule 11.

Definition.Text: cement means a powder that results from the grinding of clinker and the blending of the ground clinker with other materials. (ciment)
clinker means solid nodules that are produced by the pyroprocessing of feedstock in a kiln. (clinker)
feedstock means a ground blend of calcium carbonate, silica, alumina, ferrous oxide and any other material that is used to produce clinker. (matière première)
grey cement means cement that is manufactured from clinker that contains more than 0.5% by weight of ferric oxide. (ciment gris)
kiln means a thermally insulated chamber into which blended feedstock is introduced for pyroprocessing in order to produce clinker. (four)
long dry kiln means a kiln that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is not equipped with a system for preheating dry feedstock; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is equipped with a system for preheating dry feedstock with at most two stages of preheating before the feedstock is introduced into the kiln. (four long à voie sèche)

Definition.Text: precalciner kiln means a kiln that is equipped with a system for precalcining dry feedstock using, before the feedstock is introduced into the kiln, a secondary burner that has a tertiary supply of combustion air. (four à précalcinateur)

preheater kiln means a kiln that is equipped with a system for preheating dry feedstock with at least three stages of preheating before the feedstock is introduced into the kiln. (four à préchauffeur)
wet kiln means a kiln into which feedstock is introduced as a fine slurry with a water content of more than 20% by weight. (four à voie humide)

Section.Text: This Part applies in respect of cement manufacturing facilities that produce clinker for use in the manufacture of grey cement.

Subsection.Text: As of January 1, 2020, a cement manufacturing facility must not — over any two consecutive years — emit NOx or SO2 in a quantity that exceeds the emission limit for each of those years for that substance, as determined in accordance with sections 104 and 105, respectively.

If a cement manufacturing facility does not comply with that emission limit for either NOx or SO2 over a period of two consecutive years, it must not — during each year after that period — emit either NOx or SO2 in a quantity that exceeds its emission limit for that year, as determined in accordance with sections 104 and 105.
The emission limit for a year for the emission of NOx from a cement manufacturing facility is determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the maximum emission intensity for the year for the emission of NOx from the ith kiln stack in the cement manufacturing facility — namely, the maximum quantity of NOx emitted per tonne of clinker produced at the ith kiln in the cement manufacturing facility in the year — which is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: for preheater kilns and precalciner kilns, 2.25 kg/t, and

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: for wet kilns and long dry kilns, as elected in accordance with subsection (2),

FormulaParagraph.Label: (i)
FormulaParagraph.Text: 2.55 kg/t, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (ii)
FormulaParagraph.Text: determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the quantity of NOx, expressed in kg, that was emitted at the cement manufacturing facility in 2006 per tonne of clinker produced, as reported in respect of the cement manufacturing facility to the Minister in accordance with the Notice with respect to reporting of information on air pollutants, greenhouse gases and other substances for the 2006 calendar year, published in the Canada Gazette, Part I, Volume 141, No. 49, on December 8, 2007;
is ith kiln in the cement manufacturing facility, where i goes from 1 to n and where n is the number of kilns in the cement manufacturing facility; and
is the quantity of clinker, expressed in t, that is produced by the ith kiln in the cement manufacturing facility in the year.

Subsection.Text: A responsible person for the cement manufacturing facility who provides the Minister with a compliance report required by section 108 in respect of the year 2020 must, in that compliance report, make the election referred to in paragraph (b) of the description of EINOxi in subsection (1).

The maximum emission intensity for the emission of NOx from the ith kiln in the cement manufacturing facility for the year 2020 that is elected by the responsible person also applies for each subsequent year.

Section.Text: The emission limit for a year for the emission of SO2 from a cement manufacturing facility is determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the maximum emission intensity for the year for the emission of SO2 from the ith kiln stack in the cement manufacturing facility — namely, the maximum quantity of SO2 emitted per tonne of clinker produced at the ith kiln in the cement manufacturing facility in the year — which is 3.0 kg/t;
is the ith kiln in the cement manufacturing facility, where i goes from 1 to n and where n is the number of kilns in the cement manufacturing facility; and
is the quantity of clinker, expressed in t, that is produced by the ith kiln in the cement manufacturing facility in the year.

Section.MarginalNote: Quantity of NOx and SO2 — CEMS
Section.Text: As of January 1, 2018, the quantity, expressed in kg, of NOx and SO2 emitted, during a given year, from each kiln stack in a cement manufacturing facility must be determined by means of a CEMS.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of determining the value for Pi in sections 104 and 105, the quantity of clinker that is produced at each kiln in the cement manufacturing facility in the year must be determined by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weighing that quantity directly using the measuring devices that were used for inventory purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: using a method of calculation that is based on the measuring devices that were used for inventory purposes; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: applying a feedstock-to-clinker conversion factor, specific to the kiln, to a direct measurement of the quantity of feedstock introduced into the kiln during that year, which accurately determines the quantity of clinker that is produced from a given quantity of feedstock introduced.

Subsection.Text: The accuracy of the feedstock-to-clinker conversion factor must be verified

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least once per year, but at least four months after a previous verification; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as feasible after a major change in the clinker production processes that could affect the accuracy of the factor.

Subsection.Text: A record of that verification must be made that demonstrates the accuracy of the feedstock-to-clinker conversion factor.

Section.Text: As of January 1, 2019, on or before June 1 of every year a compliance report that contains the information for the cement manufacturing facility that is set out in Schedule 11 in respect of the preceding year must be provided to the Minister.
If a CEMS is used to determine a NOx emission intensity under Part 1 or a quantity of emissions under section 106, the CEMS Reference Method must be complied with, notably

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the design specifications and any related requirements that are set out in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Section 3.0 of the EC CEMS Code entitled “Design Specifications and Test Procedures”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Section 2.0 of the Alberta CEMS Code entitled “Design Specifications”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the installation specifications and any related requirements that are set out in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Section 4.0 of the EC CEMS Code entitled “Installation Specifications”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Section 3.0 of the Alberta CEMS Code entitled “Installation Specifications”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the performance specifications and any related requirements, particularly in respect of testing, that are set out in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Section 5.0 of the EC CEMS Code entitled “Certification Performance Specifications and Test Procedures”, including certification of the CEMS and the conduct of relative accuracy tests and bias tests of the relative accuracy test audit (RATA), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Section 4.0 of the Alberta CEMS Code entitled “Performance Specifications and Test Procedures”, including certification of the CEMS and the conduct of relative accuracy tests and bias tests of the relative accuracy test audit (RATA); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements concerning the development and implementation of manuals or plans for quality assurance and quality control that are set out in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Section 6.0 of the EC CEMS Code entitled “Quality Assurance and Quality Control”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Section 5.0 of the Alberta CEMS Code entitled “Quality Assurance and Quality Control”.

Subsection.Text: For each year during which a responsible person uses a CEMS to determine a NOx emission intensity under Part 1 or a quantity of emissions under section 106, the responsible person must ensure that an auditor evaluates whether, in the auditor’s opinion, the responsible person has complied with the CEMS Reference Method and, in particular, whether

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the CEMS has met the specifications set out in the CEMS Reference Method;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the results of each relative accuracy test and each bias test for each of the relative accuracy test audits (RATA) for the 12 months preceding the auditor’s audit have not exceeded the applicable limit referred to in the CEMS Reference Method; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the responsible person has established a Quality Assurance/Quality Control manual that complies with Section 6.0 of the EC CEMS Code or a Quality Assurance Plan that complies with Section 5.1 of the Alberta CEMS Code and, if so, whether

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the responsible person has implemented it,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its implementation ensures that the data generated by the CEMS is complete, accurate and precise, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it has been updated in accordance with the CEMS Reference Method.

Subsection.Text: The responsible person must, within 30 days after the day on which the auditor completes their audit, obtain a report, signed by the auditor, that contains the information set out in Schedule 12.
The responsible person must, on the Minister’s request, provide the Minister with a copy of an auditor’s report within 15 days after the request.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Provision of auditor’s report to Minister
Subsection.Text: A responsible person who uses a CEMS to determine a NOx emission intensity under Part 1 must, for each year during which they use a CEMS, provide the Minister with a copy of the auditor’s report for that year by June 1 of the following year, if the opinion stated by the auditor in the report is that the responsible person has not complied with any aspect of the CEMS Reference Method.
For the purpose of this section, an auditor is a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is independent of the responsible person who uses a CEMS; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has demonstrated knowledge of and experience in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certification, operation and relative accuracy test audit (RATA) of Continuous Emission Monitoring Systems,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: quality assurance and quality control procedures in relation to those systems, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the conducting of audits in relation to those systems.

Section.Text: Unless otherwise provided by these Regulations, any measuring device that is used to determine a quantity for the purpose of these Regulations must be installed, operated, maintained and calibrated in accordance with the manufacturer’s specifications or any applicable generally recognized national or international industry standard.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may — on written application by a responsible person for a boiler, heater, engine or cement manufacturing facility — approve an alternative rule in respect of the boiler, heater or engine or a kiln located in the cement manufacturing facility to replace a rule set out in a document that is incorporated by reference into these Regulations with respect to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any requirement for sampling, analyses, tests, measurements or monitoring; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any condition, test procedure or laboratory practice that is relevant to those requirements.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception for rule to be replaced
Subsection.Text: The rule that is to be replaced must not be a rule that is contained in EPA Method 7E or EPA Method 6C in relation to the conduct of relative accuracy tests and bias tests of the relative accuracy test audit (RATA) referred to in subparagraph 109(c)(i) or (ii).
The proposed alternative rule must be a rule that the responsible person may comply with in order to comply with a provincial law in respect of the boiler, heater, engine or kiln and be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a modification of a rule set out in a document that is incorporated by reference in these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a rule, other than a rule referred to in paragraph (a), that consists of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the whole or a part of a standard or method published by

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a government of any state or of a subdivision of any state, or any institution of such a state or subdivision,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an international organization of states or an international organization that is established by the governments of states, or any institution of one of those international organizations, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: an organization that develops standards or methods based on consensus and that is internationally recognized as being competent to establish that standard or method; or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a modification of a rule described in subparagraph (i).

Subsection.Text: The application must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the following information respecting the responsible person who is the applicant:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, civic address and email address, along with an indication as to whether they are an owner or operator, or both, of the boiler, heater, engine or cement manufacturing facility,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, if any, telephone number and email address of their authorized official, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, if any, telephone number and email address of a contact person, if different from the authorized official;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each responsible person for the boiler, heater, engine or cement manufacturing facility other than the applicant, their name, civic address and email address, along with an indication as to whether they are an owner or operator of it, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of the rule that is to be replaced, along with an indication of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the provisions of the document incorporated by reference into these Regulations that set out the rule that is to be replaced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the provisions of these Regulations that refer to that document and that invoke that rule;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the text of the proposed alternative rule, along with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the source of that proposed alternative rule, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an indication of the provisions of provincial law that set out that proposed alternative rule,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a copy of a permit issued under provincial law along with an indication of the provisions of the permit that set out that proposed alternative rule, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the sources referred to in both clauses (A) and (B), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of the provisions of the standard or method referred to in subparagraph (3)(b)(i) that constitutes the proposed alternative rule or that were modified to constitute the proposed alternative rule, along with a copy of that standard or method;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a demonstration that the proposed alternative rule — read in the entire context of the rule that is to be replaced, including the context of the document within which that replaced rule is found, and read harmoniously within the scheme of these Regulations — is at least as rigorous and effective as the rule that is to be replaced;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: information that identifies the boiler, heater, engine or kiln, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the boiler or heater,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an indication as to whether it is a boiler or a heater,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the name of its manufacturer, along with its serial number, make and model,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: its rated capacity, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: in respect of the facility where it is located, its identifier, if any, within that facility and the facility’s

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: civic address,

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: National Pollutant Release Inventory identification number assigned by the Minister for the purpose of section 48 of the Act, and

Subclause.Label: (III)
Subclause.Text: provincial identification number,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the engine,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its serial number or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, its unique alphanumeric identifier,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its make and model, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: in respect of the facility where it is located, its identifier, if any, within that facility and the facility’s

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: civic address or, if there is no civic address, its latitude and longitude,

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: National Pollutant Release Inventory identification number assigned by the Minister for the purpose of section 48 of the Act, and

Subclause.Label: (III)
Subclause.Text: provincial identification number,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the kiln ,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the name of the cement manufacturing facility where it is located,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the civic address of the cement manufacturing facility or, if there is no civic address, its latitude and longitude,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the cement manufacturing facility’s National Pollutant Release Inventory identification number assigned by the Minister for the purpose of section 48 of the Act,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: information that identifies the kiln, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the kiln’s type, that is, whether it is

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: a precalciner kiln,

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: a preheater kiln,

Subclause.Label: (III)
Subclause.Text: a wet kiln, or

Subclause.Label: (IV)
Subclause.Text: a long dry kiln; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that is necessary to consider in order to grant the application.

Subsection.Text: If a proposed alternative rule described in paragraph (3)(b) concerns the determination of the concentration of NOx in a gas, other than by means of a CEMS, the demonstration referred to in paragraph (4)(e) must compare its rigour and effectiveness to the rigour and effectiveness of making that determination based on EPA Method 7E or ASTM D6522-11.

The Minister must grant the application and approve the proposed alternative rule — with any modification, or subject to any conditions, that the Minister considers desirable — if the Minister is of the opinion that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the rule that is to be replaced is described by paragraph 112(1)(a) or (b);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed alternative rule is described by paragraph 112(3)(a) or (b); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed alternative rule — read in the entire context of the rule that is to be replaced, including the context of the document within which that replaced rule is found, and read harmoniously within the scheme of these Regulations — is at least as rigorous and effective as the rule that is to be replaced.

Subsection.Text: Without delay after approving an alternative rule, the Minister must provide the applicant — and every other responsible person for the boiler, heater or engine, or the cement manufacturing facility in which the kiln is located, set out in the application — with the alternative rule, as approved.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Provision of rule to another responsible person
Subsection.Text: A responsible person referred to in subsection (2) must — on another person becoming a responsible person for it — provide that other person with the alternative rule, as approved.

Subject to section 115, an alternative rule, as approved by the Minister, replaces the rule in question that is set out in a document that is incorporated by reference into these Regulations and applies in respect of the boiler, heater, engine or kiln located in the cement manufacturing facility.
For greater certainty, the document is to be read with reference to the alternative rule, as approved, and not the rule that the alternative rule replaces.

Section.Text: A responsible person for the boiler, heater or engine, or the cement manufacturing facility in which the kiln is located, may in writing notify the Minister and every other responsible person for it that the alternative rule, as approved, no longer applies — as of the date indicated in the notice — in respect of that boiler, heater, engine or kiln located in the cement manufacturing facility.

Section.MarginalNote: Refusal — false, misleading or incomplete information

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse the application if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the responsible person has, with their application, provided false, misleading or incomplete information.
Without delay after refusing the application, the Minister must inform the applicant of the refusal, along with the reasons for it.
The Minister must revoke the alternative rule as approved by the Minister if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: new information, with supporting documents, demonstrates that the alternative rule, as approved — read in the entire context of the rule that is to be replaced, including the context of the document within which that replaced rule is found, and read harmoniously within the scheme of these Regulations — is not at least as rigorous and effective as the rule it replaces; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the responsible person had, with their application, provided false or misleading information to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: Without delay after the revocation, the Minister must notify each responsible person for the boiler, heater or engine, or the cement manufacturing facility in which the kiln is located, of the revocation, along with the reasons for it and an indication of the date of the revocation.

Section.Text: The alternative rule as approved by the Minister is revoked as of the day on which the responsible person no longer is able to comply with provincial law by complying with the alternative rule in respect of the boiler, heater, engine or kiln located in the cement manufacturing facility. Without delay after that day, the responsible person must notify the Minister in writing of that revocation, including an indication of the date of that day.

The rule set out in a document that is incorporated by reference into these Regulations and referred to in subsection 112(1) that was replaced by an alternative rule, as approved by the Minister, applies in respect of the boiler, heater, engine or kiln located in the cement manufacturing facility on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: receipt by the Minister of the notice referred to in section 115;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the revocation that is indicated in the notice described in subsection 117(2); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the revocation referred to in section 118.

Heading.TitleText: Reporting, Providing, Recording and Retention of Information

Subsection.Text: A report, notice or information that is required to be provided, or an application that is made, to the Minister under these Regulations must be provided electronically in the form and format specified by the Minister and must bear the signature or electronic signature of an authorized official of the responsible person who provides it.

If the Minister has not specified an electronic form and format or if it is impractical to provide the report, notice, information or application in accordance with subsection (1) because of circumstances beyond the control of the responsible person, the report , notice, information or application must be provided on paper, signed by an authorized official of the responsible person, in the form and format specified by the Minister. However, if no form and format have been so specified, it may be in any form and format.
A record in respect of a boiler, heater, engine or cement manufacturing facility must, to the extent that it is not otherwise required under these Regulations, be made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: of every document and all information that supports the validity of any information provided to the Minister under these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of every measurement and calculation, along with supporting documents, that are used to determine a value of an element of a formula set out in these Regulations, as well as any information, including the methodology, that is used to determine one of those values;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a CEMS is used under these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of every document or information referred to in the CEMS Reference Method that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: relates to a demonstration or test made under these Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: is required to be created or obtained under the CEMS Reference Method, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of every measurement of a concentration and of flow that is used for every calculation necessary to determine an emission intensity, along with supporting documents;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: of documents that demonstrate that the installation, operation, maintenance and calibration of measuring devices was done in accordance with these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: of any other information that is relevant to demonstrating compliance with these Regulations in respect of the boiler, heater, engine or cement manufacturing facility.

Subsection.Text: Records required to be made under these Regulations must be made within 30 days after the day on which the information to be recorded becomes available.

A record or application that is made — or a copy of a report, notice or information that is provided — under these Regulations must be kept, along any supporting documents, after it is made or provided for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least five years if it relates to a boiler, heater, or an engine; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at least 10 years if it relates to a cement manufacturing facility.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (3), any information that has been provided to the Minister by a responsible person for inclusion in the engine registry or in an online electronic reporting site that is established by the Minister does not need to be kept if the Minister has provided the responsible person with an acknowledgment of its receipt.

The record or copy referred to in subsection (3) — other than one that relates to an engine — must be kept at the facility where the boiler or heater is located or at the cement manufacturing facility.
The record or the copy referred to in subsection (3) that relates to an engine must be kept at

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any place in Canada other than the facility where the engine is located, if that place is, when the engine is registered, indicated in the engine registry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the facility where the engine is located, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: On the Minister’s request, the record or copy referred to in subsections (5) and (6) must be provided to the Minister without delay.

Section.Text: A responsible person must, without delay, inform the Minister of any errors contained in information that was provided to Minister under these Regulations and provide the Minister with the corrected information.

Subsection.Text: A responsible person for a boiler or heater who intends, by means of a stack test, to determine its NOx emission intensity for the purpose of sections 33 to 38 or a responsible person for an engine who intends to conduct a performance test on it under clause 66(2)(a)(i)(B) or section 77 or 78 or an emissions check on it under section 79 must, on the Minister’s request, provide the Minister with the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address of the place where the test or check is to be conducted or the determination or redetermination made or, if there is no civic address, its latitude and longitude;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date or dates on which it is to occur; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, telephone number and email address of a contact person who can provide the Minister with any updated information in relation to paragraphs (a) and (b).

Subsection.Text: The information must be provided

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least 30 days before the test or check is conducted or the determination or redetermination is made, if that test, check, determination or redetermination is intended to be conducted or made more than 30 days after the receipt of the request; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: without delay, in any other case.

Section.Text: The EC CEMS Code is to be read as follows:

Section.Text: The following information respecting the responsible person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to whether they are an owner or operator, or both, of the boiler or heater and their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number, email address and fax number, if any, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number, email address and fax number, if any, of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: The following information respecting the facility at which the boiler or heater is located:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address of the facility or, if there is no civic address, its latitude and longitude;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its National Pollutant Release Inventory identification number assigned by the Minister for the purpose of section 48 of the Act and its provincial identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to which paragraph of subsection 5(2) of these Regulations describes it.

Section.Text: The following information respecting the boiler or heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each responsible person for the boiler or heater, other than a responsible person mentioned in paragraph 1(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name and civic address, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether they are an owner or operator, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to whether it is a boiler or a heater;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of its manufacturer, along with its serial number, make and model;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its rated capacity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its identifier, if any, within the facility where it is located;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its commissioning date and recommissioning date, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which Part 1 first applied in respect of it;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for a class 80 or a class 70 boiler or heater, the serial number of each of its burners; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: for a class 80 or a class 70 boiler or heater, a document that indicates, with precision, where it is located in the facility.

Paragraph.Label: (k)

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 35(1)(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 35(1)(b).

Section.Text: The following information respecting a test on the boiler or heater referred to in paragraph 34(1)(a) of these Regulations conducted to determine its classification NOx emission intensity:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a stack test,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the stack test was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: confirmation that each test run of the stack test was conducted while the boiler or heater met the conditions set out in paragraphs 27(2)(a) to (e) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether the type of gaseous fossil fuel that was combusted during that stack test was natural gas or alternative gas,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the method set out in subsection 28(1) of these Regulations that was used for the stack test to measure the concentration of NOx and, if an alternative rule as approved under subsection 113(1) of these Regulations to replace a rule set out in that method was used, an indication of that rule, as approved, and of rule it replaced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the classification NOx emission intensity of the boiler or heater, as determined by means of the stack test; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a CEMS test,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for each averaging period in the reference period,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the day and hour when the averaging period began,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the number of hours in the averaging period,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: confirmation that at least 50% of the input energy in the boiler’s or heater’s combustion chamber resulted from the introduction of gaseous fossil fuel for each of those hours,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: an indication as to whether the type of gaseous fossil fuel that was combusted was natural gas or alternative gas, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the greatest of the rolling hourly averages that were determined for the NOx emission intensity,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether the EC CEMS Code or the Alberta CEMS Code was used and, if an alternative rule as approved under subsection 113(1) of these Regulations to replace a rule set out in that CEMS Reference Method was used, an indication of that rule, as approved, and of the rule it replaced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the classification NOx emission intensity of the boiler or heater, as determined by means of the CEMS test in accordance with subparagraph 34(1)(a)(ii) of these Regulations.

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether the type of gaseous fossil fuel that was combusted during that stack test was natural gas or alternative gas,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the NOx emission intensity of the boiler or heater, as determined by means of the stack test;

Paragraph.Label: (b)

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the classification NOx emission intensity of that other boiler or heater, as determined by means of the stack test; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a stack test referred to in subclause 34(1)(b)(v)(C)(I) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the stack test was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer — along with the serial number, make and model and the identifier, if any, within the facility where it is located — of each of the other boilers or heaters that share a common stack with the boiler or heater whose classification NOx emission intensity is determined under that subclause,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: confirmation that each test run of the stack test was conducted while each of the boilers or heaters that share that common stack met the conditions set out in paragraphs 27(2)(a) to (e) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether the type of gaseous fossil fuel that was combusted during that stack test was natural gas or alternative gas, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the NOx emission intensity at the common stack, as determined under subclause 34(1)(b)(v)(C)(I) of these Regulations.

Section.Text: The following information respecting a CEMS test whose results are used to determine the boiler’s or heater’s classification NOx emission intensity under paragraph 34(1)(b) of these Regulations:

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 6
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Initial Report (Boilers and Heaters) — Information Required

Section.Text: The following information respecting the responsible person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to whether they are an owner or operator, or both, of the boiler or heater and their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number, email address and fax number, if any, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)

Paragraph.Text: the civic address of the facility or, if there is no civic address, its latitude and longitude;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its National Pollutant Release Inventory identification number assigned by the Minister for the purpose of section 48 of the Act and its provincial identification number, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to which paragraph of subsection 5(2) of these Regulations describes it.

Section.Text: The following information — if it has changed since the most recent report that the responsible person has provided to the Minister — respecting the boiler or heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each responsible person for the boiler or heater, other than the responsible person referred to in paragraph 1(a), if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name and civic address, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether they are an owner or operator, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to whether it is a boiler or a heater;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of its manufacturer, along with its serial number, make and model;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its rated capacity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its identifier, if any, within the facility where it is located;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its commissioning date and recommissioning date, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if its commissioning date is within three months after the day on which these Regulations are registered, an indication as to whether it is packaged;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for a class 80 or a class 70 boiler or heater that has undergone a major modification, a description of the major modification, including the serial number of its burners if they have been changed;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: for a modern boiler for which there has been a determination of its thermal efficiency made in accordance with section 18 of these Regulations, the result of each of those determinations and the date on which each was made;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: for a modern heater for which there has been a determination of the difference between the temperature of its preheated air and the ambient air made in accordance with section 24 of these Regulations, the result of each of those determinations and the date on which each was made;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: for a boiler or heater for which the determination by means of one or more stack tests of its NOx emission intensity for an initial test is referred to in paragraph 33(2)(a) or subparagraph 33(2)(b)(i) of these Regulations, for the stack test that determined the greatest NOx emission intensity and for the stack test that determined the most recent NOx emission intensity from among those stack tests conducted in the reference period or each applicable period within the reference period referred to in subsection 33(5) of these Regulations, respectively,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the NOx emission intensity that was determined,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which that stack test was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: confirmation that each test run of the stack test was conducted while the boiler or heater met the conditions set out in paragraphs 27(2)(a) to (e) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: for modern boilers or heaters, an indication as to whether the type of gaseous fossil fuel that was combusted during that stack test was natural gas or alternative gas, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the method set out in subsection 28(1) of these Regulations that was used for the stack test to measure the concentration of NOx and, if an alternative rule as approved under subsection 113(1) of these Regulations to replace a rule set out in that method was used, an indication of that rule, as approved, and of the rule it replaced; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: for a boiler or heater for which the determination by means of a CEMS test of its NOx emission intensity for an initial test is referred to in paragraph 33(2)(a) or subparapraph 33(2)(b)(ii) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for each averaging period in the reference period,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the day and hour when the averaging period began,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the number of hours in the averaging period,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: confirmation that at least 50% of the input energy in the boiler’s or heater’s combustion chamber resulted from the introduction of gaseous fossil fuel for each of those hours,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: for modern boilers or heaters, an indication as to whether type of the gaseous fossil fuel that was combusted was natural gas or alternative gas, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the NOx emission intensity, being the greatest of the rolling hourly averages that were determined for the NOx emission intensity,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether the EC CEMS Code or the Alberta CEMS Code was used and, if an alternative rule as approved under subsection 113(1) of these Regulations to replace a rule set out in that CEMS Reference Method was used, an indication of that rule, as approved, and of the rule it replaced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for a determination referred to in paragraph 33(2)(a), the name of the manufacturer, along with the serial number, make and model and the identifier, if any, within the facility where the other boiler or heater — on which the CEMS test referred to in paragraph 26(2)(b) was conducted — is located.

Section.Text: The following information — if it has changed since the most recent report that the responsible person has provided to the Minister — respecting the boiler or heater:

Paragraph.Label: (e)

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for a modern boiler for which there has been a determination of its thermal efficiency made in accordance with section 18 of these Regulations, the result of each of those determinations and the date on which each was made;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for a modern heater for which there has been a determination of the difference, if any, between the temperature of its preheated air and the ambient air made in accordance with section 24 of these Regulations, the result of each of those determinations and the date on which each was made;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for a boiler or heater for which the determination by means of one or more stack tests of its NOx emission intensity for a compliance test is referred to in subparagraph 38(2)(a)(i) or (c)(i) or paragraph 38(3)(a) of these Regulations, for the stack test that determined the greatest NOx emission intensity and for the stack test that determined the most recent NOx emission intensity, from among those stack tests conducted in the reference period or each applicable period referred to in paragraph 38(3)(a) or subsection 38(5) of these Regulations, respectively,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the NOx emission intensity that was determined,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the NOx emission intensity, beingthe greatest of the rolling hourly averages that were determined for the NOx emission intensity,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for a determination referred to in subparagraph 38(2)(a)(ii), the name of the manufacturer, along with the serial number, make and model and the identifier, if any, within the facility where the other boiler or heater — on which the CEMS test referred to in paragraph 26(2)(b) was conducted — is located.

Section.Text: The following information respecting the responsible person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, civic and postal addresses, if any, telephone number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, if any, telephone number and email address of their authorized official;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, if any, telephone number and email address of a contact person, if different from the authorized official;

Paragraph.Label: (d)

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: their gross revenue, and the gross revenue of each of those affiliates, for the most recent taxation year for which each of them has filed a return of income.

Section.Text: The following information respecting each of the responsible person’s pre-existing engines:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if its rated brake power is less than 250 kW, its rated brake power, expressed in kW; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if its rated brake power is at least 250 kW,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its rated brake power, expressed in kW, and its make , model and serial number,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of emission control system, if any, with which it is equipped,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the civic address of the facility where the engine is located or, if there is no civic address, its latitude and longitude, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: for each of its responsible persons, other than the responsible person referred to in paragraph 1(a), if any, their name and civic address.

Section.Text: The following information respecting a responsible person who registers an engine in the engine registry, applies for a unique alphanumeric identifier for an engine or replaces a pre-existing engine in their group with a replacement unit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, civic and postal addresses, if any, telephone number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, if any, telephone number and email address of their authorized official;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, if any, telephone number and email address of a contact person, if different from the authorized official;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to whether they made an election under subsection 61(1) of these Regulations and, if so, the date on which they made the election; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to whether they revoked their election under subsection 62(1) of these Regulations and, if so, the date on which a notice of revocation was provided.

Section.Text: The following information respecting the facility at which the engine or replacement unit is located:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address of the facility or, if there is no civic address, its latitude and longitude;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its National Pollutant Release Inventory identification number assigned by the Minister for the purpose of section 48 of the Act and its provincial identification number, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a modern engine, an indication as to which paragraph of subsection 46(4) of these Regulations describes; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for a pre-existing engine, an indication that the facility is an oil and gas facility other than an asphalt refinery.

Section.Text: The following information respecting the engine or replacement unit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indication as to whether the responsible person referred to in section 1 is its owner or operator, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if that responsible person became an owner of the engine on a date that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: on or after the day on which these Regulations are registered, that date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: before the day on which these Regulations are registered, an indication to that effect;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each of its responsible persons, other than the responsible person referred to in section 1, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name and civic address, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether they are its owner or operator, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its serial number or if, the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, its unique alphanumeric identifier;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its make and model;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an engine, an indication as to whether it is a pre-existing engine or modern engine;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an engine, an indication as to whether it is low-use or regular-use;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: its rated brake power, expressed in kW;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an engine, an indication as to whether it is

Subparagraph.Text: a two-stroke lean-burn engine,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a two-stroke rich-burn engine,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a four-stroke rich-burn engine;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the type of emission control system, if any, with which it is equipped and, if it was so equipped on a date after March 31, 2020, that date;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a modern engine, the date on which it began to operate;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a pre-existing engine,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which it was designated as belonging to the responsible person’s group, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the date on which that pre-existing engine ceased to belong to the responsible person’s group;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a replacement unit,

Subparagraph.Text: the serial number — or, if the serial number is not known or cannot be obtained, the unique alphanumeric identifier — of the pre-existing engine that it replaced,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which that pre-existing engine ceased to belong to the responsible person’s group,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of hours that that pre-existing engine operated while belonging to the group during the 36 months preceding that date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication as to whether it is a modern engine, an electric motor or a combustion turbine;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: if the group of engines of the responsible person referred to in section 1 is subject to section 59 of these Regulations, an indication that the engine belongs to the subset referred to in that section; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: if the responsible person referred to in section 1 is subject to a limit referred to in section 60 of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the identifier of the subgroup to which the engine or replacement unit belongs and the date on which it was designated as so belonging,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for an engine that has a default NOx emission value referred to in subparagraph 66(2)(a)(i) of these Regulations, an indication as to whether clauses 66(2)(a)(i)(A) to (C) are complied with, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for an engine that has a NOx emission value assigned under subsection 67(1) of these Regulations that is different from its default NOx emission value set out in subsection 66(2) of these Regulations,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the NOx emission value that is assigned to it, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an indication that

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: the assigned NOx emission value is greater than the NOx emission intensity for the engine that was determined by means of the most recent performance test conducted on it, and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: the responsible person has a record of the information set out in subparagraphs 100(i)(i) to (iii) of these Regulations and section 6 of Schedule 10 in respect of that most recent performance test.

Section.Text: The following information respecting each subgroup that the responsible person established under section 65 of these Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its identifier; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the units, either ppmvd15% or g/kWh, that are used to express the NOx emission value of the pre-existing engines and replacement units belonging to that subgroup.

Section.Text: The name and telephone number of the responsible person who is providing the compliance report.

For each of the responsible person’s engines, the total number of hours, if any, contained in all periods referred to in section 49 of these Regulations in the preceding year for which the compliance report is provided.

Paragraph.Text: the name of the person and of the individual, if different, who conducted the performance test and the date on which it was conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a lean-burn engine, for at least one emissions check during each 365-day period referred to in paragraph 79(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the emissions check was conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
